component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.title: Button
component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.text: A component to render a simple button {{uxs-button "BUTTON TEXT"}}

attributes.name: Button
attributes.description:
A component to render a simple button

{{uxs-button "BUTTON TEXT"}}

component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.title: UXS Button
component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.text: A component to render a simple button {{uxs-button "BUTTON TEXT"}}

attributes.name: UXS Button
attributes.description:
A component to render a simple button

{{uxs-button "BUTTON TEXT"}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable this button.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired.

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description: Set to true to enable the button to appear inline with other buttons or inline components. The button will use the inline-block display property.

arguments.name: loading
arguments.description:
Set to true if the button has already been pressed or should be disabled while another action takes place.

If the loadingText argument has been provided this will be displayed, defaults to "Loading".

This will activate it's loading style and also prevent any actions from being fired..

arguments.name: mini
arguments.description:
Deprecated

Use the size="small" argument instead.

arguments.name: naked
arguments.description: Strip away any background styles and just display the buttons text.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
Add a custom name to your button, used for aria labels & test selectors.

By default this will be the same as the text argument unless you parse a different value.

arguments.name: selected
arguments.description:
Set's the button style to a selected state.

Can be used to toggle buttons or to infer an active state without disabling the buttons action.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
Set the size of the button. Default is medium.

UXS ships with the following stock sizes: giant, huge, large, medium, small, tiny.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-massive-size

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the button.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: secondary, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-custom-style

arguments.name: text
arguments.description:
The buttons text, this can be set as the first positional parameter.

It will also default to the components name.

component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.title: UXS Button Link
component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.text: A component to render a link as a simple button {{uxs-button-link "BUTTON TEXT" "photos.edit" photo}} {{#uxs-button-link "photos.edit" photo}} BUTTON TEXT {{/uxs-button-link}}

attributes.name: UXS Button Link
attributes.description:
A component to render a link as a simple button

{{uxs-button-link "BUTTON TEXT" "photos.edit" photo}}

{{#uxs-button-link "photos.edit" photo}}
  BUTTON TEXT
{{/uxs-button-link}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description:
Set to true to disable this button.

This will activate it's disabled style and also prevent any actions from being fired.

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description: Set to true to enable the button to appear inline with other buttons or inline components. The button will use the inline-block display property.

arguments.name: mini
arguments.description:
Deprecated

Use the size="small" argument instead.

arguments.name: naked
arguments.description: Strip away any background styles and just display the buttons text.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
Add a custom name to your button, used for aria labels & test selectors.

By default this will be the same as the text argument unless you parse a different value.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description:
Set the size of the button. Default is medium.

UXS ships with the following stock sizes: giant, huge, large, medium, small, tiny.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-massive-size

arguments.name: style
arguments.description:
Set the style of the button.

UXS ships with the following stock styles: secondary, warning, error, dark, grey, mid, light & white.

You can customise your component by using any string here and adding your own css for the custom modifier e.g. .button--my-custom-style

arguments.name: text
arguments.description:
The buttons text, this can be set as the first positional parameter.

It will also default to the components name.

component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.title: Content
component:ember-ux-sauce/components/uxs-.text: A typographic component to render content text {{uxs-content "Lorem ipsum dolar"}} {{#uxs-content}}Lorem ipsum dolar"{{/uxs-content}}

attributes.name: Content
attributes.description:
A typographic component to render content text

{{uxs-content "Lorem ipsum dolar"}}

{{#uxs-content}}Lorem ipsum dolar"{{/uxs-content}}

fields.name: base
fields.description: The BEM base name for this component: "content"

fields.name: testSelectorName
fields.description:
The test selector name defines the name of the [data-test-*] attribute binding
Default is "content"

fields.name: testSelectorValue
fields.description:
The base property is used as the value for test selectors.
_Default is the value of "name"

fields.name: layout
fields.description: The path to the handlbars template

arguments.name: align
arguments.description: The text align direction, "left", "center", "right" or "justified". Defaults to no alignment (inheret)

arguments.name: name
arguments.description:
The name of the component. This property also defaults to the value for test selectors.

The default is true, which ensures the test selector is added. If set to false the test selector is not rendered.

arguments.name: style
arguments.description: Adds a style modifier to the component. Standard options are "white", "light", "mid", "grey", "dark", "primary", "accent", "success", "warning" or "error". Defaults to no style (inheret) Default values will set the text color.

arguments.name: text*
arguments.description:
The text to be rendered inside this component
This can be passed in as the first positional parameter

template:application-tailwind.title: Your Tailwind styles
template:application-tailwind.text: Your Tailwind styles A reference for every generated class in your app.

template:docs/components/avatars.title: Avatars
template:docs/components/avatars.text: Avatars Avatars are used to display images of users or resources. Simple Usage Avatars come in different shapes & sizes. Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: size* String Possible Values: small, medium, large, huge, giant round Boolean border Boolean Styles Usage You can customise the look of your lists with the style attribute.

template:docs/components/datalists.title: Datalist
template:docs/components/datalists.text: Datalist Datalist are used to display record details, think of them as readonly form controls. Simple Usage Styles Usage You can customise the look of your datalist with the style attribute.

template:docs/components/icons.title: Icons
template:docs/components/icons.text: Icons The icon component is used to render icons from the Material Icons font library. Simple Usage Let's look at a basic example of a name control where you require two inputs to sit alongside each other Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: icon* String style String size String disabled Boolean Icons Sizes Icons are available in a variaty of sizes. Note: when inlining icons with text set the inline attribute to true to float the element. Tiny Small Medium Large Huge Giant Action Usage You can pass action closures to icons

template:docs/components/lists.title: Avatars and Actions
template:docs/components/lists.text: Avatars and Actions This is a list that includes some horizontal layout for the avatar and item. We use the aside and body contextual components to split up each items layout. Icon Avatars You can use icons for the list items avatar. Text Avatars You can use text for the list items avatar too. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your lists with the style attribute. List Notices Contextual Components The List Item component has the following child components: aside Alias of uxs-div, used to seperate horizontal layout blocks body Alias of uxs-div, used to seperate horizontal layout blocks, unlike aside, this component will grow to fill the available width title Alias of content Alias of detail Alias of avatar Alias of action Alias of

template:docs/components/menus.title: Menus
template:docs/components/menus.text: Menus Simple Usage Two simple examples. The menu widths adjusts to accommodate the content in keyline increments. Disabled Items The disabled property disables a Menu Item. The Divider can be used to separate MenuItems. Icons Menu items supports icons through the leftIcon and rightIcon attributes. Secondary Text Menu Items support a secondaryText attribute. Subheadings Menu Items can include subheadings to split up items. Dropdown Menu You can use the basic dropdown component to display menus in your app. Normal nav item And another This one is a link Icon Dropdown Menu This is a menu with an icon trigger. Normal nav item And another This one is a link Styles Usage You can customise the look of your menu with the style attribute.

template:docs/components/notice.title: Notice
template:docs/components/notice.text: Notice This component can be used to display notices to the use in a variaty of styles... Simple Usage Let's look at a basic example of a notice. Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: text* String style String truncated Boolean Usage with Icons You can also intergrate icons in a notice. Usage with Links Links & buttons can be included in a notice.

template:docs/components/pagination.title: Pagination
template:docs/components/pagination.text: Pagination The pagination component provides control for a paginated json api response. Simple Usage This example calls a controller action with the current page size and results. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your toolbar with the style attribute.

template:docs/components/pills.title: Pills
template:docs/components/pills.text: Pills Pills are comenly used to display tags or inline statuses. They are usually colored to reflect their content. Simple Usage Let's look at a basic example of a pill. Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: text* String style String size String rounded Boolean Pill Sizes Pills are available in a variaty of sizes. Tiny Small Medium Large Huge Giant Pills With Icons Add icons to your pills.

template:docs/components/preamble.title: Preamble
template:docs/components/preamble.text: Preamble This component can be used to display some key info to a user before the main content is displayed. Simple Usage Let's look at a basic example with an icon and text message. Custom Usage Let's look at a basic example with an icon and text message.

template:docs/forms/_button-links.title: Button Links
template:docs/forms/_button-links.text: Button Links The button-link component is like the button component but extends the Ember link-to component so you can link to other routes. Usage Like link-to, this component takes one or two arguments: The name of a route. In this example, it would be docs.patterns At most one model for each dynamic segment. If there is no model to pass to the component, you can provide an explicit value instead In addition to being used as a block expression, the button-link component can also be used in inline form by specifying the link text as the first argument to the component: Let's look at an inline example: Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: text* String disabled Boolean inline Boolean loading Boolean style String Possible Values: "primary", "accent", "black", "white", "gray" mini Boolean naked Boolean name String Defaults to dasherized "text". You can override this by passing in an alternative string. selected Boolean Block Usage Block Button Link

template:docs/forms/button-groups.title: Button Groups
template:docs/forms/button-groups.text: Button Groups The button group component is used to group buttons togther. It uses contextual components, so if you render buttons or button links inside a group, the button components will inherit the groups disabled, inline & mini properties. Usage Let's look at a basic example: Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: align For inline groups. Possible Values: "center", "left", "right" disabled Boolean inline Boolean mini Boolean

template:docs/forms/button-links.title: Button Links
template:docs/forms/button-links.text: Button Links The button-link component is like the button component but extends the Ember link-to component so you can link to other routes Usage Let's look at a basic example. This button links to the quickstart route. You can play around with some of the arguments in this demo. To see a full list check out the api page Inline Buttons By default link-buttons will be displayed as block items. To set them as inline pass true to the inline argument. Because button links extend from the link-to component their active (selected) state will be detected automatically. Stock Style Examples Here's an example of the button in all it's stock styles: Stock Size Examples Here's an example of the button in all it's stock sizes:

template:docs/forms/buttons.title: Buttons
template:docs/forms/buttons.text: Buttons The button component is used for clickable actions. This could be to submit a form or to trigger an ember action. Usage Let's look at a basic example. You can play around with some of the arguments in this demo. To see a full list check out the api page Actions The button component fires an action on tap/click. Actions are passed as closure actions. The action will not be fired if the component is disabled or in a loading state. Inline Buttons By default buttons will be displayed as block items. To set them as inline pass true to the inline argument. Stock Style Examples Here's an example of the button in all it's stock styles: Stock Size Examples Here's an example of the button in all it's stock sizes:

template:docs/forms/controls.title: Form Controls
template:docs/forms/controls.text: Form Controls The form control component is used as a container for a form input, label, validation & other common form UI. Basic Usage Let's look at a basic example: Form Control content. Common Usage Let's look at a common example where we define the controls child element through properties: Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: label String tip String warning String error String type String value String disabled Boolean Custom Usage Although the above should cover 90% of your common use cases, we can customise the control with contextual components: Compact Controls Setting compact to true takes up less space. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your control with the style attribute.

template:docs/forms/date-time-inputs.title: Form Date & Time Inputs
template:docs/forms/date-time-inputs.text: Form Date & Time Inputs The form dat & time input component extends from the FlatPickr addon component. As such you can pass any of it's attributes attributes Basic Usage Let's look at a basic example with a change action called when changing the value Attributes value Mixed A single dateObject A single string containing a date formatted accordingly to dateFormat An array of dateObject An array of string containing dates formatted accordingly to dateFormat Actions onChange (required) onClose onOpen Each action receives 3 parameters. An array of dateObjects A string formatted accordingly to dateFormat representing the last selected date The Flatpickr instance Styles Usage You can customise the look of your input with the style attribute.

template:docs/forms/dropdowns.title: Dropdown Controls
template:docs/forms/dropdowns.text: Dropdown Controls The form drowdown component extends the ember power select component. As such you can pass any of the power select attributes Basic Usage Let's look at a basic example of using the drowdown component. It is always used in block format to enable flexible templationg of your optiosn. Power select aims to be maximally flexible and because of that it doesn't try to make strong assumptions about how you want to use it. e.g. two way bind the selected property. Instead it embraces DDAU (Data Down Actions Up) philosophy so data flow always is unidirectional and explicit. The onchange event must be handled in your template. This example shows the most common use, update the property on select. For this we can use the ember mut helper. Selected: label String Styles Usage You can customise the look of your dropdown with the style attribute.

template:docs/forms/index.title: Form
template:docs/forms/index.text: Form Model bound form This following example shows a form bound to an ember model demonstrating a variety of basic controls.

template:docs/forms/inputs.title: Form Inputs
template:docs/forms/inputs.text: Form Inputs The form input component extends from embers input component. As such you can pass any of the standard input attributes Basic Usage Let's look at a basic example with two way binding on the value and an action on pressing enter label String Further Usage This example includes futher attributes to control the input: value String readonly Boolean placeholder String disabled Boolean maxlength Number min Number max Number step Number type String Possible Values: "text", "password", "number", "hidden", "email", "search", "tel", "url" Styles Usage You can customise the look of your input with the style attribute.

template:docs/forms/rows.title: Form Control Rows
template:docs/forms/rows.text: Form Control Rows The form control row is a display component to render form components like inputs inline. This component is just a presentational wrapper that will yeild content in a flexbox row. Like the control component, when rendering contextual components properties on the control, like model & disabled a passed though automatically to the input components. Inline Input Usage Let's look at a basic example of a name control where you require two inputs to sit alongside each other disabled Boolean Inline Button Usage Here's a common search box pattern where we need an inline button. Input Icon Usage Finally, you can use this component to prefix or suffix inputs with icons. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your rows with the style attribute. In this example the style attribute is inherited by the row from uxs-form.

template:docs/forms/textareas.title: Form Textareas
template:docs/forms/textareas.text: Form Textareas The form textarea component extends from embers textarea component. As such you can pass any of the standard textarea attributes Basic Usage Let's look at a basic example with two way binding on the value and an action on pressing enter label String Further Usage This example includes futher attributes to control the input: value String rows String cols String placeholder String disabled Boolean maxlength Number wrap Boolean readonly Boolean autofocus Boolean spellcheck Boolean Possible Values: "text", "password", "number", "hidden", "email", "search", "tel", "url" Styles Usage You can customise the look of your textarea with the style attribute.

template:docs/layout/app.title: App
template:docs/layout/app.text: App The app component is used to wrap the contents of your application vertically. It's normally placed in the application template. Usage Content... Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: fixedNav Boolean

template:docs/layout/header.title: Header
template:docs/layout/header.text: Header The header component is used to frame your page layouts. It combines a toolbar with a page title. Usage Contextual Components The Hero component has the following child components: heading Alias of uxs-heading toolbar Alias of uxs-toolbar With an image background Styles You can customise the look of your header with the style attribute.

template:docs/layout/hero.title: Hero
template:docs/layout/hero.text: Hero The hero component is used to give your pages impact. Usage Contextual Components The Hero component has the following child components: heading Alias of uxs-heading content Alias of uxs-content button Alias of uxs-button button-link Alias of uxs-button-link

template:docs/layout/navbar.title: Navbar
template:docs/layout/navbar.text: Navbar The navbar component is used to render the main nav bar of your application. Usage The example below shows common usage of the nav bar with an embeded . Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: title String fixed Boolean Styles Usage You can customise the look of your navbar with the style attribute.

template:docs/layout/pane.title: Pane
template:docs/layout/pane.text: Pane The pane components are used unside a window to present horizontal content. Splash Layout The splash layouts pane will position content in the middle of the window. This layout is also perfect for using a splash image for the background. Single Layout The single layout places content in one large padded pane. Two Column Layout The main pane will take up 2/3 of the window width a side pane taking up the rest. Three Column Layout Three even panes 1/3 of the window width. Properties Now explore the various properties available in this component: type String (aside, detail, full, index, main, single, splash) padded Boolean style String Styles Usage You can customise the look of your panes with the style attribute.

template:docs/layout/toolbar.title: Toolbar
template:docs/layout/toolbar.text: Toolbar The header component is used to frame your page layouts. Usage Contextual Components The Hero component has the following child components: back Alias of uxs-icon title Alias of uxs-subheading spacer Alias of uxs-div action Alias of uxs-icon Toolbar Search Styles You can customise the look of your toolbar with the style attribute.

template:docs/layout/window.title: Window
template:docs/layout/window.text: Window The window component is used to present horizontal content blocks as "panes". Usage Col 1 Col 2 Col 3 Usage Col 1 Col 2 Col 3 Styles Usage You can customise the look of your window with the style attribute. Col 1 Col 2 Col 3

template:docs/lists/avatars.title: List Avatars
template:docs/lists/avatars.text: List Avatars Avatars are used to display a graphical representation of a resource. Image Avatars Images avatars display an image url. Text Avatars Text Avatars display a text string. Icon Avatars Icon Avatars display an icon. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your list avatars by passing the style attribute to the avatar component. The default style will be either dark or white text depending on what contrasts with the parents list style. Properties The uxs-avatar, uxs-avatar-icon & uxs-avatar-text components have the following properties: src* The image path for uxs-avatar, This can be passed in as the first positional parameter. String icon* The icon name/path for uxs-avatar-icon, This can be passed in as the first positional parameter. String text* The avatar text for uxs-avatar-text, This can be passed in as the first positional parameter. String bordered Adds a border to the bottom of the list item. Default: false Boolean rounded Display a round avatar. Default: false Boolean style Define the color/style of the list. Default: 'dark' String size Define the size of the avatar. Default: 'medium' String

template:docs/lists/index.title: Lists
template:docs/lists/index.text: Lists Lists are used to display collections of records in a defined order. Example This is a basic lists using contextual child components. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your lists by passing the style attribute to either the list or the list-item component. Properties The uxs-list component has the following properties: style Defined the color/style of the list. Default: white String bordered Adds a border to the bottom of both child list items and subheadings. Boolean lines Fixes the height to accomodate 1-3 lines of content in the body of child list items. Default: 1 Number (1-3) Contextual Component The List component has the following child components: item Alias of subheading Alias of notice Alias of

template:docs/lists/items.title: List Items
template:docs/lists/items.text: List Items List items are used to render each item of you list. The items tend to contain 1 - 3 "columns" of data. These could be an avatar, text or actions. Basic Example This is a simple list containing just a title for each item. Adding more content This is a list contains some meta data and includes a bottom border. By defining the lines & border property on the list component, these properties are passed to each item and will set the height and bottom-border. Avatars and Actions This is a list that includes some horizontal layout for the avatar and item. We use the aside and body contextual components to split up each items layout. There is a variaty of avatar components you can use in lists including: image, text and icon avatars. See the for details. Styles Usage You can customise the look of your list items by passing the style attribute to the list-item component, this will override any style passed to the parent list. Properties The uxs-list-item component has the following properties: style Defined the color/style of the list. String bordered Adds a border to the bottom of the list item. Default: false Boolean disabled Disables the list item, will stop any action being fired. Default: false Boolean lines Fixes the height to accomodate 1-3 lines of content in the body. Default: 1 Number (1-3) Actions The uxs-list-item component has the following actions: list-item onClick Fired on list item component click. list-item.aside onClick Fired on list item aside component click. list-item.body onClick Fired on list item body component click. list-item.action onClick Fired on list item action component click. Contextual Components The List Item component has the following child components: aside Alias of uxs-div, used to seperate horizontal layout blocks body Alias of uxs-div, used to seperate horizontal layout blocks, unlike aside, this component will grow to fill the available width title Alias of content Alias of detail Alias of avatar Alias of avatarIcon Alias of avatarText Alias of action Alias of

template:docs/lists/notices.title: List Notices
template:docs/lists/notices.text: List Notices Lists can be used to hightlight a list in certain contexts. e.g. an active filter. Example Styles Usage You can customise the look of your list notices by passing the style attribute to the list-subheading component.

template:docs/lists/subheadings.title: List Subheadings
template:docs/lists/subheadings.text: List Subheadings Subheadings are used to group list items. You can group a flat model collection with an addon like ember-cli-group-by. Example Styles Usage You can customise the look of your list subheadings by passing the style attribute to the list-subheading component. The default style will be either dark or white text depending on what contrasts with the parents list style. Properties The uxs-list-subheading component has the following properties: text* The subheading text. This can be passed in as the first positional parameter. String bordered Adds a border to the bottom of the list item. Default: false Boolean style Defined the color/style of the list. Default: white String

template:docs/patterns.title: Patterns
template:docs/patterns.text: Patterns Here's a summary of the patterns we use and encourage authors to follow when extending this addon. BEM All the Things Make Use of ember-test-selectors Create Accessible Components Build Components on Top of the Shared Mixins Use Ember Prop Types BEM All the Things Use BEM Sauce to add some BEM sugar to your components. Make Use of ember-test-selectors Test selectors enable better element selectors in Ember.js tests. When designing components we try and use nested test selectors inline with the BEM style. All components should allow the passing of a name parameter that will be used as the value for all test selectors. This helps authors target to elements when multiple instances exist. In the case of components rendered in loops, either use model id's or a zero based index. Use Closure Actions Stop bubbling actions and use closure actions Create Accessible Components Write this Use Ember Prop Types All UX components use the ember-prop-types addon to validate properties.

template:docs/quickstart.title: Quickstart
template:docs/quickstart.text: Quickstart This quickstart guide will get you going with a docs site for your brand new addon. 1 - Install the addon. yarn add ember-ux-sauce 2 - Install ember-cli-sass yarn add ember-cli-sass 3 - Add styles to your app.scss file @import "uxs"; 4 - Include reset css in ember-cli-build.js let app = new EmberApp(defaults, { // ... sassOptions: { includePaths: [ 'node_modules/reset-css' ], }, }); 5 - Restart Ember Server Customising Sass You can control much of the UX toolkits look and feel with sass variables. To override the defaults: 1 - Create a new sass file to hold your custom variables touch app/styles/_settings.uxs.scss 2 - Add it to app.scss before you include the uxs files @import "settings.uxs"; @import "uxs"; 3 - (Optional) Include uxs tools.functions file so it can be used in your settings in settings.uxs.scss @import "uxs/tools.functions"; 4 - Override variables @import "uxs/tools.functions"; $c-primary: #2682C4; $c-accent : #4A74B7; $c-success: #8FC93A; $c-error : #D84F4F; $c-warning: #FFC031; $c-dark : #001021;

template:docs/settings/colors.title: Settings
template:docs/settings/colors.text: Settings The following variables are available to customise. Colors Base Pallet $c-dark / .bg-dark $c-grey / .bg-grey $c-mid / .bg-mid $c-light / .bg-light $c-white / .bg-white Primary Pallet $c-primary-1 / .bg-p1 $c-primary-2 / .bg-p2 $c-primary-3 / .bg-p3 $c-primary-4 / .bg-p4 $c-primary-5 / .bg-p5 Accent Pallet $c-accent-1 / .bg-a1 $c-accent-2 / .bg-a2 $c-accent-3 / .bg-a3 $c-accent-4 / .bg-a4 $c-accent-5 / .bg-a5 Success Pallet $c-success-1 / .bg-s1 $c-success-2 / .bg-s2 $c-success-3 / .bg-s3 $c-success-4 / .bg-s4 $c-success-5 / .bg-s5 Warning Pallet $c-warning-1 / .bg-w1 $c-warning-2 / .bg-w2 $c-warning-3 / .bg-w3 $c-warning-4 / .bg-w4 $c-warning-5 / .bg-w5 Error Pallet $c-error-1 / .bg-e1 $c-error-2 / .bg-e2 $c-error-3 / .bg-e3 $c-error-4 / .bg-e4 $c-error-5 / .bg-e5

template:docs/settings/typography.text: Settings The following type variables are available to customise. Font Sizes Giant / 76.244px Huge / 47.123px Large / 29.124px Medium / 18px Small / 11.125px Type Settings Heavy Type orci etiam platea parturient lectus urna a id in adipiscing proin interdum vel dis pretium ut at condimentum nisl in suspendisse urna auctor hac venenatis. Medium Type orci etiam platea parturient lectus urna a id in adipiscing proin interdum vel dis pretium ut at condimentum nisl in suspendisse urna auctor hac venenatis. template:docs/typography/index.title: Typography
template:docs/typography/index.text: Typography Common typography components. Text A basic component to render text with. It defaults to body text, but by using the arguments it can be customized. Text Align left center right justified Size tiny small normal large huge giant Style dark grey mid light white primary accent success warning error Weight light normal bold Headings align String style String giant Boolean huge Boolean Subheadings Content Text Lacinia et parturient mus quam cum bibendum ut ut consequat mi at a a viverra sociosqu scelerisque ligula a class. Parturient eu donec ullamcorper vestibulum fermentum dui penatibus ullamcorper mi a nascetur vestibulum a nostra consectetur a pulvinar dignissim integer fermentum laoreet leo condimentum dapibus hac scelerisque. Neque vestibulum a eros auctor venenatis adipiscing adipiscing parturient ornare nisl gravida adipiscing litora inceptos adipiscing praesent in porta a morbi lectus porttitor mattis at elit. template:docs/typography/lists.title: Lists
template:docs/typography/lists.text: Lists List typography components. Ordered Lists Unordered Lists Definition Lists

template:docs/typography/tables.title: Tables
template:docs/typography/tables.text: Tables Table all the things! Tabular Data Example This example shows using tables to represent data. Rows can be grouped by sections and certain rows highlighted. Record Tables This is a more traditional use of tables to represent a collection of resoruces. This should be used in place of a uxs-list where appropriate.

template:index.title: Motivation
template:index.text: Motivation Looking for the quickstart? . This Addon aims to provice the basic componets found in most Ember projects at Sauce. These components share common api's and also at common css styleguide. The styleguide in the addon is designed to be customisable to suit each project. Customisation can start from tweaking fonts and colors all the way to spacing and vertical rhythm. Read the docs
